answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The most probable cause for the odd sensation could be neuropathy, a disorder of the nerves. Headaches can be a consequence of this or due to other causes like migraine, hypertension or inflammatory disorders. Most common cause for neuropathy is diabetes.  It can also be due to metabolic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, infections and traumatic injuries. The sensation may need proper evaluation by your GP, please consult him for a cardiovascular and neurological assessment.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Ive been sick for quite some time now. Since April, ive been experiencing this liquid, dripping like sensation going down both sides of my temples. It feels like I'm bleeding or someone is pouring warm water down my temples and scalp. I also suffer from nausea, migraines, sinus pressure and anxiety. I have had MRI and CT scan of my brain. both were negative. I had blood tests, ANA test, endoscopy..everything is fine. I cant figure out what else it might be. Any ideas. Pleassse help me
title: liquid sensation
